Title: Junior Merchant
RoleDescription:
As a Junior Merchant, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product class. Your ranges will become our Wayfair Verified items (Wayfairs super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will support strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Brand Management, Category Management, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...
As a Junior Merchant, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will ultimately decide which products will be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels, with a crisp business justification to support your selection and robust alignment with key stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

1-4 years experience within a retail and/or omni-channel buying or merchandising role  
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 3 days per week, Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham &  1 day a week per week remote. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.

$19/hour

Overview:
As a Logistics and Inventory Specialist, youll play a critical role in ensuring seamless operations as Wayfair's Physical Retail team reimagines the shopping experience. From managing inventory flow and conducting audits to processing shipments and resolving discrepancies, your work will directly support an exceptional customer shopping experience. With a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving, this role will focus on maintaining inventory accuracy, resolving logistical exceptions, and optimizing efficiency. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, collaborates effectively with partner teams, and is passionate about owning and creating a flawless operational foundation reflecting Wayfairs commitment to a top-tier experience and retail excellence.
 
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Specialist Do?

Demonstrates Reliability: Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This helps ensure we're ready and available to help our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Perform daily audits and maintain a robust Cycle Count Program to safeguard the integrity and accuracy of inventory records. Leverage scan technology to document carton-level details like condition, quantity, and location.
Manage Inventory Performance: Monitor aging inventory, process markdowns, and execute damage write-offs to maintain accuracy and efficiency. Handle vendor returns for recalls, dead stock, and overstock inventory while leveraging experience in inventory management or e-commerce to optimize processes.
Receive and Process Shipments: Unload and receive inventory with care, including the manual handling of large and heavy goods. Ensure all inventory is processed correctly, capturing detailed records of overages, shortages, or damages.
Proactively Monitor Systems: Use order management tools and Warehouse Management Software to track inventory movement, troubleshoot discrepancies, and maintain up-to-date records. Regularly review Cycle Count data using Google Sheets to identify and address gaps.
Audit Operations: Conduct regular and triggered audits for inbound and outbound trucks to ensure accurate processing and shipment flow.
Support Operational Excellence: Use a ticketing system to manage exceptions, resolve issues, and provide input on improving existing processes and tools based on your day-to-day experience.
Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with logistics leaders and other teams to streamline operations, share insights, and uphold Wayfairs commitment to operational excellence.
Adapt and Problem-Solve: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by taking ownership of inventory challenges, driving solutions, and ensuring smooth coordination between warehouse and retail operations.

Education: High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
Inventory Control Experience: 1 to 3 years of inventory control experience, preferably in a retail environment, is required.

Title: SEC Senior Accountant
RoleDescription:

Wayfairs Finance group is looking for a Senior Accountant to join our team! This role will reside on the SEC Reporting team within the Wayfair Finance Department. This is a fast scaling position and will be able to offer a lot of career progression at a growing public company. This is a dynamic role and offers exposure to many areas of accounting and finance, including SEC Reporting and technical accounting areas such as debt and equity..The SEC Reporting team is responsible for the preparation of our financial statements that are filed with the SEC and ensures they are in compliance with GAAP and SEC regulations. Title: Senior Associate, Labor Planning
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Final Mile Centers in Norton, MA or Linden, NJ. 
The Senior Associate of Labor Planning plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.
